data.description: Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Join Adobe’s Experience Manager (AEM) Customer Engineering team—the expert group at the front lines of helping enterprises craft, deliver and optimize digital experiences at scale. Our team supports AEM developers and business users across the globe, guiding them through performance tuning, problem solving, debugging complex issues and expanding what’s possible with AEM as a Cloud Service. As an AEM Customer Engineering Intern, you’ll get hands on exposure to one of the most powerful enterprise Content Management Systems in the world. You’ll work closely with AEM experts to build internal tools that enhance customer support efficiency, improve workflows and streamline team operations. This is an incredible opportunity to learn how high scale systems are supported in production and to grow your technical and problem-solving skills in a collaborative, innovative environment. The work you'll do is unique—you'll dive into Adobe Experience Manager’s modern cloud stack, which touches technologies such as: Java, Sling, and OSGi frameworks Adobe I/O Runtime and microservices CI/CD automation through AEM Cloud Manager Frontend frameworks like React and GraphQL If you thrive in solving technical puzzles, enjoy working on tools that make other engineers more efficient, and want to contribute to real customer impact—this role is for you. All 2026 Adobe interns will be co-located hybrid. This means that interns will work between their assigned office and home. Interns will be based in the office where their manager and/or team are located, where they will get the most support to ensure collaboration and the best employee experience. Managers and their organization will determine the frequency they need to go into the office to meet priorities. What You’ll Do Learn AEM’s technology stack—from authoring to publishing, from the backend (Sling, OSGi, Oak) to frontend frameworks (HTL, React). Design and develop internal tools and automations to help Customer Engineering streamline diagnostics and support workflows. Analyze and improve existing processes by identifying efficiency opportunities and building practical solutions. Solve and investigate AEM issues, learning debugging techniques used in enterprise environments. Contribute to internal documentation and wikis to support continuous information flow. Engage in team discussions and standups, learning agile workflows and customer support methodologies. Partner with internal stakeholders across Product Engineering and Customer Success teams to understand cross functional operations. ​What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related technical field or equivalent degree required with an expected graduation date of December 2026– June 2027 Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September Technical or functional skill requirements of the position HTML, JavaScript, CSS, REST APIs, JSON, XML Languages such as Java or Python — with an understanding of object-oriented principles Excellent communication and collaboration skillsOur compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $25.00 -- $30.00 hourly. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay rate for your job location during the hiring process.State-Specific Notices:California:Fair Chance OrdinancesAdobe will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and “fair chance” ordinances.Colorado:Application Window NoticeThere is no deadline to apply to this job posting because Adobe accepts applications for this role on an ongoing basis. The posting will remain open based on hiring needs and position availability.Massachusetts: Massachusetts Legal NoticeIt is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more. Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.
